intro: Guzmania zakii, commonly known as the red-tipped pineapple plant, is a striking member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, long-lasting inflorescence that often features a red or orange bract. Its rosette-shaped leaves are typically dark green with a waxy texture. Guzmania zakii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires moderate humidity to flourish.
